page.title: 07LIVING AT LOWER HIRST FARM
page.content:
My name is Marie Walker and I am ten years old. Our family has lived at Lower Hirst Farm since 1945 but the farm is 200 years old. The farm is on the northern outskirts of Sheffield but inside the city boundary. The fields are on a hillside called Back Edge, above the River Don. There are a few cottages around the farm and some of our relatives live there. We don't live far from Parson Cross School where Howard and I go. There is a lot of industry and houses around the farm.
The farm covers 42.5 acres, 40 acres for grazing and 2.5 acres for potatoes this year. My Dad has his own machinery for mowing, turning and bailing hay. He used to grow crops but he said it was a waste because there are too many birds around.
